name: Hotel Nilya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful small hotel with a very attractive, flower-filled courtyard, and a great view from the second floor balcony. Our room was reasonably sized and very comfortable. The bathroom was more than adequate with a large, rain-head shower. Everything was spotless.
reviews.title: Pretty Much Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent. Fruit, cheese, bread, jams, vegetables, eggs. The staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: The lovely rooms come with a complimentary travel agency!

reviews.text: Would absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: Completely perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We don't often give "five star" ratings - - even to the five star resorts where we've stayed. Hotel Nilya isn't the Ritz Carlton, but our experience was so nice and so different, it gets a perfect score. First, some preliminaries:
reviews.title: I normally don't do this but I was impressed by my experience so far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Disregard all reviews before April, 2011. That's when the current owners bought the property. Their commitment to quality and the money they obviously invested makes earlier reviews irrelevant.
reviews.title: Lovely and great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived in Selcuk by bus the friendly fellow at the bus station offered to ring the hotel for us and assured us that Erdal would be along to pick us up, which he did in a matter of minutes. Similarly, he drove us to and from Ephasis and back to the bus station when we left. This sort of service really makes Nilya stand out.
reviews.title: A beautiful boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very attentive, yet unobtrusive, each day after our wanders they were keen to offer a tea or coffee in the lounge.
reviews.title: Tranquil and an absolute gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a double suite, for a bit of extra space, which worked well as there was a couch to relax on. The rooms are extravagently decorated in the Turkish style, reflecting the owners artistic inclination. The bathroom was also very clean and beautifully decorated. We found the heating and the shower worked well and were nice and warm in the middle of Winter. We did need to leave the water running for quite a while until the hot came through, but then it was a great shower.
reviews.title: Great with perhaps still some improvements required.

reviews.text: The pre prepared breakfast each morning was very tasty and was complimented by eggs cooked to our liking. Tea and coffee was available any time at no extra charge.
reviews.title: A gem in Selcuk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is free wifi with worked well in the lounge and in our room, as we were immediately above.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly and beautiful rooms

reviews.text: Our flight from Kayseri was delayed by 2 hours and we ended up arriving at Selcuk at almost midnight. Despite totally exhausted, we were still able to figure that the hotel is so tastefully decorated, from the entrance garden to a bedside lamp. Every detail is attended to. We have booked a tour leaving at 8am the next morning and requested an early breakfast (their normal hour starts 8am). It was one of the best throughout our trip in Turkey - such a pity that we have to rush to finish it and was staying for 1 night only. Location wise it's walkable to the Museum and St John Basilica. We took the train to Denizli and they were kind enough to offer a ride to take us to the train station.
reviews.title: What a pity! Should have stayed longer...
A wonderful boutique hotel in the lovely town of Selcuk!
reviews.text: This is a terrific property. The owners and staff cannot do enough for their guests. The rooms are lovely, with hand carved dark wood furniture and filled with art pieces from their shop down the road. The courtyard is spectacular, with seating for breakfast or drinks- filled with flowers and trees and a lovely fountain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their sister hotel Bella, is just around the corner and has a great rooftop terrace restaurant with good food and reasonable prices. There is a carpet and ceramic store on the main floor, but there is no pressure to buy at all. I would highly recommend this property and would recommend that people take the time to see Selcuk and not just visit Ephesus ( which the cruise ships unfortunately do not do, they just dump people at Ephesus for the day and then leave that night and miss everything else about this lovely area).
reviews.title: So incredible, we're going back!

reviews.text: This really is the place to stay in Selcuk. The hotel itself is lovely and breakfast was fabulous, but it is truly the people of both Hotel Nilya and Hotel Bella that sets them apart. We stayed for three nights and whatever was needed -- a lift to and from Ephesus, recommendations on other things to see in the area, as well as finding us a telephone charger to replace one that didn't work -- nothing was too much trouble! We had room 12, which is their beautiful suite, decorated in ceramics. There was plenty of room for everything, and we were able to sit on the second floor terrace or in the courtyard, flowers everywhere. We had dinners at Hotel Bella, in their roof-top restaurant, which were excellent. Their fixed price menu provides for soup, two starters, a main course and a desert, all for 25 Turkish lira. We had such a nice time that we have changed our plans to return to Hotel Nilya for our last night in Turkey!
reviews.title: amazing

reviews.text: We had a great 2 night stay at the Nilya. Everything was amazing from the location to the room to the advice to the breakfast. We also used their travel agency and had great guided tours of Aphrodisia, Pammukale, and on toward Bodrum. We truly felt we had a home in Selcuk.
reviews.title: A Very Friendly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel while exploring nearby Ephesus. The hotel was wonderful and arranged all transfers, a guide, and even another trip to a nearby wine producing village, Sirince. The front desk even mailed postcards for me.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and interestingly decorated.
reviews.title: Quaint, Quiet, Relaxing

reviews.text: The only downside was that one of the hotel owners got very upset when I bought a rug from another shop. I would recommend hiding any purchases not made at their store (or just not buying anything). Since this happened at the end of the trip, it didn't really impact our stay, however, I think if it had happened earlier they may not have been so nice about coordinating all of our transportation and guides. For this reason, I'm only giving them 2 stars for service.
reviews.title: A hotel with character friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as a base for exploring Ephesus and it was so enjoyable- quiet, relaxing, very helpful staff. Very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Top, best, fantastic. Don't look anywhere else!

reviews.text: It is a hotel with character. Staff are friendly and helpful. The downside is the room has only one window on the corridor side and the lighting is not enough. So we had to cover the window with curtain so the room was quite dark. There is no TV either which we were fine since we didn't hv time to watch anyway. A great place to experience country side though. BtW this hotel is only one min. away from St. John Castle.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

description: Hotel Nilya, located in the quiet area of St Johns Basilica. With 12 rooms, some 1st floor balcony level, views through the valley to 13th Cent. Isabey Mosque, Pamucak beach, beautiful sunsets or overlooking the garden courtyard. Other rooms on the ground floor opening to the garden courtyard, outdoor seating amongst trees, flowers, bird song and waterfall. Rooms are decorated in traditional Ottoman style, with hand carved furniture and marbled bathrooms. WI-FI access in each room. Relax in our lounge area with open fire (seasonal), enjoy filtered coffee or a drink from our bar, while relaxing with a book, or talking with other guests. Located within 5-10 mins walking distance of historical sites, museum and town centre. Free shuttle service to Ephesus. A mere 300 mtrs, 2 min walk from our other hotel, Hotel Bella.
